Low reward=low motivation

My old leader help build a hospital, bragged about his staff all over the country and respected all of us. The entire department of 4 hospitals and 6 ERs has fell apart in less than three months. The director from Ensemble is useless. Dont even think he can log into Epic. Has no clue what my manager and what to do. HIS BOSS at least can register a patient. Almost all my coworkers will be using this as a platform to document things so others can stay away. We have had enough of our leaders leaving and if things are not immediately changes a lot of openings for reg go unfilled

pros: Great company who takes good care of employees

pros:
vacation time 
decent pay
decent equipment 
Good benefits
cons:
They over work their employees and under staff the departments. They want the most amount of work out of the least amount of employees.  If someone quits, it takes months to get a new person in and that's if the position even gets approved to be posted. Meanwhile, the other employees in that department have to work harder to make up for that lost position. Some  employees are thrown around to other locations and have to work different shifts and times to compensate for less staff.  
They hire you and tell you that you will work at a certain location and have a certain type of schedule. Once you move here and start working, they tell you that you are going to work at all the locations and start changing your schedule all around.

job_title: Financial Services Representative in Charleston, SC
pros:
-Good medical, dental, and life insurance
-Generous PTO
cons:
-Little-to-no upward mobility. I was a Financial Services Representative and basically the only way to get a promotion was for someone in your department to vacate their position. I'm not sure if this is indicative of the organization as a whole, but it seems to be very commonplace for FSRs to never even get the chance to interview for a higher-paying position.
-No pay raise in 2013. This one hit us all very hard. The payroll tax expired in January as well, which made it very hard to make ends meet for anyone who didn't earn a lot to begin with. They danced around the issue for several months, and really angered a lot of the employees because they wouldn't give us a straightforward answer. This has led to several people applying for positions at MUSC because they simply pay more.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Charleston, SC
pros: Good coworkers and staff.Nice environment to work in.
cons: Pay is below average compared to similar companies. Raises (if you recieve one) are terrible and they love to waste your time filling out employee evaluation forms every year knowing good and well they already know what they're going to give you regardless.PTO is terrible too. They made employees use their PTO to cover the days they were off for Hurricane Florence. Basically punishing employees for something that is out of their control. You also have to use 2 days of PTO or go two days unpaid before they let you use your EIH it's so ridiculous.

review_title: A great organization  to work for and I wish I could have kept working there
pros: The have good benefits and a good good reputation in the community. They truly care for the patients.  A culture of respect is fostered and encouraged.
cons: They want their nurses to go back to school (and even contribute financially) but then don't help them stay in the system. There is a push to have nurses get higher degrees.  I went back to school and became a nurse practitioner but then I couldn't get hired in the system- they only wanted to hire nurse practitioners that had experience. My 17 years as a reliable, hard working RN didn't count towards anything. I would have loved to stay in the system.

review_title: Unethical and Immoral place to work
job_title: Med Tech II in Mount Pleasant, SC
pros: They offer tuition reimbursement and decent benefits if you are single and in shape.
cons: Money hungry management cares more about money than patient care and safety.  Management is incompetent and shows favoritism to people who keep unethical habits hush hush. Unqualified and uncertified techs hired to save money. Whistleblowers are fired. HR will not help you. This makes for bad moods daily and a very unpleasant place to work. Turnover rate is enormous and the lab would not have survived this long without sticking travel techs in constantly open positions. The only area hospital who does not require techs to be ASCP certified!

review_title: I was a Cardiac RN in the Heart & Vascular Tower's cardiac step-down unit.
pros: Flexible scheduling, appropriate availability of supplies/equipment, nurse:patient ratio is safe and effective, management/leadership provides proper resources for true patient-centered care
cons: Inpatient nursing is generally challenging, and Roper's patients are quite sick, so the work can be totally exhausting (mentally, physically, emotionally).

review_title: Roper is an excellent healthcare group which is faith based and patient driven focused on compassion, faith, excellence.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Murrells Inlt, SC
pros: Faith based and patient driven with focused on healing all people with compassion, faith, and excellence.
cons: Roper's physicians partners group is more growth driven and not as strong in the compassion, and faith area, as well as focused on growing middle management.

review_title: A company that stays ahead of the pack
pros: This is a company that is constantly striving to remain competitive in a tough market to be competitive in. The politics of healthcare make intense scrutiny of every move a very real challenge, but RSF rises to that challenge and continues to do what's right.
cons: The politics of a competitive healthcare environment make it very stressful if you are not accustomed to that sort of thing.

pros: Benefits' package is competitive, not for profit organizations, opportunities to work in different specialties within the organization as a nurse, nursing scholarships are available
cons: I really can not think of any at this time. If I had to say, I think that my job should be at our main hospital instead of in Ladson as I work with many clinical folks on a daily basis.

pros: Friendly environment with diverse job opportunities. Staff are well informed of issues that affect healthcare. My schedule is flexible and the medical benefits are excellent.
cons: Comparible positions at other institutions pay higher. There are plenty of chances for professional development, but many of the available positions posted are lateral moves.

review_title: Don't wanna work here in EVS.......
pros: Benefits are decent....Nurses and doctors are very nice...
cons: Supervisor is awful yells at and lies to you, he has his pets works and who does nothing. Management dont want to hear what is going on in there, she just sweeps it under the rug. Gone to HR not sure what they do with it, told it is being investigated, yeah for 6 months.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Charleston, SC
pros: Smaller hospital that is more community oriented with closer knit employee relationships.
cons: Very low pay, much lower shift and holiday differentials compared to other area hospitals, patient to staff ratios just went up, new CEO seems more interested in bottom line than satisfaction and well being of employees.

pros: Roper's environment is one you really feel like you matter. Genuine concern for the patients and the community. There are many reasons why they are voted the best place to work in Charleston.
cons: In my case an upper level manager had no clue what we did in our department. Immediate supervisor was great and as well as the one above this particular person. You have this most places.

pros: Roper St. Francis is a fantastic place to work with some great people. The pay here is very competitive for the area. The company really seems to care about their employees. Benefits are solid and offered to full time and part time employees.
cons: There are some employees who don't have pride in their job. It is difficult to have anyone fired at this company which means that bad apples stick around.

job_title: Call Center Operator in Mount Pleasant, SC
pros: co workers are willing to help each other
cons: management has not training methods in place for new employees. Director uses supervisors to do what he doesn't want to do; fire or reprimand. pretends to want to help but doesn't want to be bothered. Works a couple days a week and monitors emails as if he is in the building. Arrogant and tricky.  To unorganized!!!!  Shows favoritism among employees. Rules do not apply to all employees. Some employees are not allowed to do what others do and nothing is said.

review_title: Overall great company with multiple facilities.
pros: Great, hard working co-workers. Can easily get overtime as needed. Physicians are professional and knowledgeable. Professional development program is top notch.
cons: Rate of pay for longevity is low. Nurses coming in make the same as a nurse who has been there for years. Cerner computer charting system is terrible.

review_title: You have to know someone to get a job there
pros: The organization is staffed with well-respected physicians; facilities are new and state of the art.
cons: You can be an experienced professional, and have precisely the qualifications required for a position, but unless the HR manager wants to put you through to the hiring manager, forget it.

pros: Good benefits, mostly good people trying to do what is best for the patients. A lot of options for receiving care and for writing referrals.
cons: The physicians are definitely a good old boys club. Management at the practice level is poor. Too much micromanaging that interferes with quality patient care. NPs are paid WAY LESS than PAs.

pros:
Benefits package is pretty decent. Free parking is a plus.
Bonuses are offered occasionally.  Use of the rehab gym is available for a small fee.
cons:
Teams do not work well together.
Low moral.  Equipment is sparse and outdated.  Productivity numbers do not reflect the actual workload.  Extremely under staffed.  Patient safety risks because of limited staffing.

pros: The teamwork is amazing and with the increasing workload everyone needs to pull together to survive.
cons: The culture is changing rapidly and no one seems worried. Hopefully the Board will wake up and vet the current leadership a little better.

pros: Lot of different task in electrical, HVAC, plumbing fields. Work mostly in clean indoor environment.  Nice people. Place for growing in skills.
cons: Managers have no idea about most of tasks. Work culture stops in last Century.  Employee often feel not comfortable, about 1/3 new living company in first year.

review_title: I really enjoy working with the people at Roper St. Francis Healthcare.   You get great experience opportunities.
pros: Opportunities to move around to different departments to get more experiences in different fields.
cons: You have the occational management that is not willing to work with you on anything.

pros: Great work to life balance. Roper has competitive pay for the area. They also have opportunities to move up in the company. They also have tuition reimbursement to continue education
cons: The commute. The Charleston area has heavy traffic and small spaces. Roper provides shuttles to their downtown locations to make the commute smaller.

pros: Room for advancement,safe clean environment,friendly people,state of the art equipment, full benefits
cons: The only thing I didn't care for is the health insurance tiers, based on your physical fitness. It's not enough of a problem to avoid working there though.

pros: Decent path of advancement for career growth. Excellent benefits with superb health insurance and ancillary bennies such as Roper Learning Center (childcare).
cons: Weak professional education program. Low starting salary that get locked into despite additional education. Minimum education requirements are very low but perhaps that is healthcare in general.

pros: Health and life insurance available, paid time off. Enjoyable working environment due to great co-workers.
cons: Typical corporate environment that can be dismissive when you have concerns.  Lack of respect from upper management, office manager was a novice and overwhelmed.

job_title: Call Center Operator in Charleston, SC

cons: Management. Although I wasn't involved directly, drama was at an all-time high. My second month of working my manager packed her things up on her lunch and quit with no warning, just sent out a mass email.
